Learn more 143 Citations Introduction Skills and Expertise Device Modelling Semiconductor Device Physics Device Physics Applied Physics Publications Publications (20) Non-Linear CNN-Based Read Channel for Hard Disk Drive With 30% Error Rate Reduction and Sequential 200-Mbits/s Throughput in 28-nm CMOS Article Apr 2023 Yuwei Qin Ruben Purdy Alec Probst [...] Jian-Gang Zhu In this work, we present the world first ASIC implementation of a machine learning (ML)-based data detection channel for hard disk drives (HDDs) using a customized convolutional neural network (CNN). The chip demonstrates a 30.3% error rate reduction over the state-of-the-art HDD detection channel with two-dimensional magnetic recording (TDMR) sett... View Non-linear CNN-based Read Channel for Hard Disk Drive with 30% Error Rate Reduction and Sequential 200Mbits/second Throughput in 28nm CMOS Conference Paper Jun 2022 Yuwei Qin Ruben Purdy Alec Probst [...] Jian-Gang Jimmy Zhu View ASIC Implementation of Non-linear CNN-based Data Detector for TDMR System in 28nm CMOS at 200Mbits/s Throughput Article Jan 2022 Yuwei Qin Ruben Purdy Alec Probst [...] Jian-Gang Zhu In this work, we present the first ASIC implementation of a convolutional neural network (CNN)-based data detection channel for the two-dimensional magnetic recording (TDMR) system in HDD. This chip is fabricated in TSMC 28nm CMOS. TDMR signals captured from a real HDD is used to train and test the network, and the chip is designed to make inferenc... View CNN-Based Machine Learning Channel on TDMR Drive Data Article Full-text available Nov 2021 Yuwei Qin Pradhan Bellam Rick Galbraith [...] Jian-Gang Zhu In this paper, we demonstrate a convolutional neural network (CNN) based data detection channel on real data from a commercial hard disk drives employed with TDMR dual-reader technology. The neural network has two sets of input neurons and is trained using 485 4k-byte sectors from the drive. Data detection is performed using the trained network and... View TDMR Performance Gain with Machine Learning Data Detection Channel Conference Paper Aug 2021 Yuwei Qin Pradhan Bellam Rick Galbraith [...] Jian-Gang Zhu View TDMR with Machine Learning Data Detection Channel Article Jun 2021 Yuwei Qin Jian-Gang Zhu In this paper, we present a systematic study of using a machine learning (ML) data detection channel consisting of a convolutional neural network (CNN) for data recovery in a two-dimensional magnetic recording (TDMR) setting with two displaced readers. To mimic the actual head skew angle change over the entire disk platter, data recovery over a wid... View Automatically Resolving Inter-Track Interference with Convolution Neural Network Detection Channel in TDMR Article Aug 2020 Yuwei Qin Jian-Gang Zhu Convolution neural network (CNN) is used as the data detection channel for two-dimensional magnetic recording (TDMR). We demonstrate that by only feeding interfered multi-reader signals as well as the target binary data at supervised learning, it is possible for CNN to automatically resolve the inter-track interference (ITI) in a noisy environment... View Deep Neural Network: Data Detection Channel for Hard Disk Drives by Learning Article Jan 2020 Yuwei Qin Jian-Gang Zhu The application of a deep neural network (DNN) as the detection channel for hard disk drive (HDD) data recovery at high user bit density and prominent magnetic transition jitter noise are investigated in this work. Directly trained with the un-equalized readback signals without any prior knowledge of the magnetic recording channel, the DNN can auto... View +1 Impact of straightened thermal profiles generated by gapped near field transducers on HAMR SNR Article Full-text available Jan 2020 Cheng-Ming Chow Mengxue Yin Yuwei Qin [...] Jian-Gang Zhu In this work, heat assisted magnetic recording (HAMR) is simulated to assess the areal density advantages of various realistic thermal profiles. Specifically, finite element simulation and micromagnetic modeling are used to assess the areal density consequences of a straighter thermal profile with an associated wider track. This assessment is done... View Impact of Magnetic Medium Grain Height in Heat Assisted Magnetic Recording Article Mar 2019 Yuwei Qin Jian-Gang Zhu Comparing with conventional perpendicular magnetic recording, heat assisted magnetic recording occurs at temperatures more than twice as high in Kelvin. The ability of head field to align the medium magnetization over the short duration in recording a bit is limited by the ratio of magnetic potential energy over the thermal energy. In this paper, w... View Micromagnetics of FePt-L1₀ Media With Thermally Insulating Magnetic Grain Boundaries Article May 2018 Yuwei Qin Jian-Gang Zhu The Curie temperature distribution induced from grain size variation in heat-assisted magnetic recording (HAMR) can be alleviated by including the thermally insulating magnetic grain boundaries. In this paper, we present a systematic micromagnetic study on this new type of HAMR media, focusing on the impact to the recording behaviors from the excha... View Electrically Tunable Polarizer Based on Graphene-loaded Plasmonic Cross Antenna Preprint Mar 2018 Yuwei Qin Xiaoyan Y.Z. Xiong Wei E. I. Sha Li Jun Jiang The unique gate-voltage dependent optical properties of graphene make it a promising electrically-tunable plasmonic material. In this work, we proposed in-situ control of the polarization of nanoantennas by combining plasmonic structures with an electrostatically tunable graphene monolayer. The tunable polarizer is designed based on an asymmetric c... View +2 Electrically Tunable Polarizer Based on Graphene-loaded Plasmonic Cross Antenna Article Full-text available Mar 2018 Yuwei Qin Xiaoyan Y.Z. Xiong Wei E. I. Sha Li Jun Jiang The unique gate-voltage dependent optical properties of graphene make it a promising electrically-tunable plasmonic material. In this work, we proposed in-situ control of the polarization of nanoantennas by combining plasmonic structures with an electrostatically tunable graphene monolayer. The tunable polarizer is designed based on an asymmetric c... In this paper, we present a systematic micromagnetic study on the effects of non-vanishing field beyond track edges in practical head designs, focusing on the recording characteristics beyond track e... View Machine Learning Based MoM (ML-MoM) For Parasitic Capacitance Extractions Conference Paper Dec 2016 Ming He Yuwei Qin Li Jun Jiang This paper is a rethinking of the conventional method of moments (MoM) using the modern machine learning (ML) technology. By repositioning the MoM matrix and unknowns in an artificial neural network (ANN), the conventional linear algebra MoM solving is changed into a machine learning training process. The trained result is the solution. As an appli...
